column5: Hey congrats on the purchase they are great cars!  I'm impressed with these new engines power/mileage but I think the addition and refinement of the new 6spd transmissions have a lot to do with it. There is so much that can be done with the transmission to optimize economy.

I have a 1987 Buick Grand National original owner,the turbo V6 is an amazing motor.I have done some upgrades over the years and right now it has about 450 hp without touching the engine,just the exhaust,air,chip,the thing is a rocket a real head snapper  when the turbo kicks in.
congrats on your new ride i bet that 6 will still go 50 over the limit

I was on the verge of buying an 87 but couldnt close the deal  A friend of mine has a collection of GN's and T-Types in his family. A couple of them ive been in the drivers seat of on many occasions, and always exit the car with a big grin on my face lol.  His last project was a tear down of a T-Type and a motor swap from the original Turbo motor to a TWIN TURBO V6!!! Insanity!
Enjoy the new ride Scott.  You'll be ticketed on the 401 in no time ya speed demon. lol

JUST BOUGHT A NEW 2012 MUSTANG YESTERDAY AND WONDERED IF ANYONE HAD THE NEW V6 305HP AND HOW THEY LIKED IT. WOULD OF LOVED A 5LITRE BUT THAT WAS ANOTHER 12G ON TOP  LOL THE NEW SIXES BEAT THE OLD EIGHTS NOW ANYWAYS  LOL  AND GREAT MILAGE
See how things work out for the good. Now you can take the 12 G's you saved and put it towards a better bass boat WITH a motor!
Did you buy the optional $15.49 shoe horn to get people into the back seat??
WAS SUPPOSE TO BE BASS BOAT YR BUT MY CAR MET HER TIME. NEEDS OVER WANTS RIGHT  LOL  MAYBE BASS BOAT FOR MY 40TH  LOL
ya coulda bought a Yaris AND a Bass boat  But they wouldnt be as purdy !! Love the looks of the new Mustang.Congrats
ONLY GOT THE FRONT SEAT SHOEHORN  LOL GONNA HAVE A HELL OF A TIME PUTTIN MY FLOAT ROD IN THERE LOL OH WELL GOT 2 NOW. 08 AND 12
Is it for you,,or her.LOL  Looked at them at the local dealer here.They sure are sweet looking.  Nice buy.
BOUGHT HER THE O8 LAST YR SO I GUESS THATS MINE NOW AND SHE GETS THE NEW ONE. WOULDNT WANNA TAKE A BRAND NEW CAR LIKE THAT TO MY JOB SITES  LOL I GET WEEKEND VISITATION RIGHTS THOUGH   LOL
Good stuff!!!! 6 cylinder mustangs make great bass bote tow vehicles!!!
Hope you signed up for the Shell pay pass mastercard. You're gonna need it.
ONLY 8MILES LESS TO THE GALLON THEN THE HONDA CIVIC. I CAN LIVE WITH THAT   LOL UNREAL HOW THESE MOTORS HAVE MORE HORSEPOWER AND GET BETTER MILAGE EVERY YR
i think you should get a new keyboard before a new car
First, I thought you'd learned to stop YELLING!!!  Second, If it ain't a V8, it ain't no real Mustang!  Third, how you gonna tow that Bass boat when you get it?
Took a 6 banger out for a test drive awhile back. Man do they ever have a lot of giddy up for a six !
LIKE I SAID I WANTED THE 8 BUT ANOTHER 12G'S. WHEN I GET MY THIRD JOB ILL UPGRADE. AS FOR TOWING WELL ILL WORK ON FINDING BOAT FIRST  LOL

Congrats on the new wheels ...it is amazing what they can do with a 6 ,  I own a V6 that I have had for 24 years now, never meet a V8 stang I never walked all over with it,I just might have to find one of these  305 hp V6  stangs to see how they go,I miss the days when there were 5.0s everywhere to run against.

Congrates! Great car the new mustang, always a classic. Why would you need more HP ? In the 70's a boss 302 was rated at around 300 hp and that was considered plenty....mind you '71 boss 302 today in mint wold be more than your '12 and it wouldn't get the 30 mpg yours is rated at.  Enjoy  But watch out for the speed traps
LOOKED AT BOSS 302 2012. COMES 2 SEATER WITH ALL RACING TOYS. 448 HP NOW LOL  60 GRAND. FOR THAT MIGHT AS WELL GET A SHELBY . 540HP

MANY a Mustang came with a straight six when they were first released '64 with the small block 289 cu engine being the main stay V8 for many years.  Did I read the OP first post correctly.....$12,000.00 to upgrade to a V8 engine...there must be a LOT more then a engine up grade for that price.  My friend Nick had '65 Mustang when we were in high school and the one nice thing about the back seat is your girlfriend pretty much had to give you a lap dance back there...  ...but my '68 Roadrunner had much more room for some serious make in the back seat.  I really enjoy seeing the old muscle cars from the 60's and 70's come back although not quite the same....those were the days of pure horse power and great style without concern for aerodynamics and mileage being a concern because gas was only .28 to .35 per US gallon...

It'll go plenty fast enough. The 6's of today are more powerful then the 8's of yesterday. Back in the early 90's we used to race 5.0 stangs. With some work we'd get up to 300hp and they were plenty fast. Enjoy!

You'll be happy with the 6...  my buddy who's driven 5.0L's his whole life picked up the 6 and says it's much better then his 8's ever were, plus better on fuel...  you can't beat that...  Enjoy - Giggity Giggity

Great purchase,, we have a '10 just a pony package ,, standard ,black ,it had the look i wanted for the mustang i always wanted,i love it when the kids want to race me , it is hard not to drive by one of them and look and laugh at the their muffler and they think they are ready to go.. nothing better than a mustang and ford got it right this time for sure,,, as for the back seat - if your not sitting in it ,dont worry about it,.I was going to get one a few years back but needed a truck first so it got on the back burner until last year , the dealership keeps on phoning for another oil change ,,i brought it in just before christmas at 5000 kms ,, and the dealer says ,most mustangs are very low mileage and are hard to get in for the scheduled oil changes , we still only have 8000 kms on it . Nothing better than shining it up and going for a drive .Lots of power even for our little pony v6 . I just have to ask my wife if i can drive it once in awhile and usually its only when it needs gas ... funny how she will never take my truck to get gas ...
Your stang is 44 years newer then mine.  I'll get'er fixed up one day.  Always had the outlook that a true Stang had to be a V8.  Curious to see how the V6 runs though(is it aleast dual exhaust?)

I had a chance to drive a 6 cylinder a couple years back and was really amazed at how much power it really had.  My brother owned one of the original '65s back in the day and I used to drive it as much as he did. Not much power from the little 289 but with the rag top down and 3 on the floor it was alot of fun.  Sure would like to have it today !!

12,000 to get to a 5.0 makes sense. Its alot more than just the motor that is upgraded. The GT package is what your getting.  I too like the retro resurgence thats come about in the last few years. Didnt like the thunderbirds though.  Im still waiting for buick to bring back the Grand National turbo 6's. The regal however has totally morphed from what it was in the 85-87 era. However.......there is a turbo motor package in the new ones.
